title: Giuseppina Pasqua
text:
Giuseppina Pasqua (24 October 1851 – 24 February 1930) was an Italian <a href="opera">opera</a> singer who performed throughout Italy and Europe from the late 1860s through the early 1900s. She began her career as a <a href="soprano">soprano</a> when she was only 13, but later retrained her voice as a <a href="mezzo-soprano">mezzo-soprano</a>. She sang in several world premieres, but is most remembered today for having created the role of Mistress Quickly in <a href="Giuseppe%20Verdi">Giuseppe Verdi</a>'s "<a href="Falstaff%20%28opera%29">Falstaff</a>". The composer wrote the role specifically for her and dedicated the act 2 aria "Giunta all' albergo" to Pasqua. She was married to the <a href="baritone">baritone</a> Astorre Giacomelli.
Biography.
Giuseppina Pasqua was born in <a href="Perugia">Perugia</a> to a prosperous family. She studied at the music conservatory in Perugia under Ulisse Corticelli and made her professional opera debut at the city's <a href="Teatro%20Morlacchi">Teatro Morlacchi</a> in 1868 singing the <a href="coloratura%20soprano">coloratura soprano</a> role of Oscar in Verdi's "<a href="Un%20ballo%20in%20maschera">Un ballo in maschera</a>". After further study with <a href="Marietta%20Piccolomini">Marietta Piccolomini</a>, she made her house debut at the in <a href="Palermo">Palermo</a> as Marguerite de Valois in <a href="Giacomo%20Meyerbeer">Meyerbeer</a>'s "<a href="Les%20Huguenots">Les Huguenots</a>". She was still singing soprano roles when she made her <a href="La%20Scala">La Scala</a> debut on 1 September 1872 as Ännchen in <a href="Carl%20Maria%20von%20Weber">Weber</a>'s "<a href="Der%20Freisch%C3%BCtz">Der Freischütz</a>".
She then studied with <a href="Luigia%20Abbadia">Luigia Abbadia</a> in Milan to retrain her voice as a mezzo-soprano. In 1876 she sang Preziosilla in the first performance of Verdi's "<a href="La%20forza%20del%20destino">La forza del destino</a>" at the <a href="Teatro%20San%20Carlo">Teatro San Carlo</a> in Naples. The following year she had a huge success as Amneris in the <a href="Teatro%20Comunale%20di%20Bologna">Teatro Comunale di Bologna</a>'s first performance of Verdi's "<a href="Aida">Aida</a>", a role which she would repeat with similar success as La Scala 1878. As a mezzo-soprano she sang leading roles throughout Italy and the rest of Europe. She was a guest artist at the <a href="Bolshoi%20Theatre">Bolshoi Theatre</a> in Moscow in 1878–1879, and in 1879 she sang Leonor de Guzmán in "<a href="La%20favorita">La favorita</a>" at both the <a href="Royal%20Opera%20House">Royal Opera House</a> in London and the <a href="Bavarian%20State%20Opera">Bavarian State Opera</a>. She was also very popular in Spain and Portugal where she sang many times. She was the "<a href="prima%20donna">prima donna</a> contralto" at the <a href="Liceu">Gran Teatre del Liceu</a> in Barcelona for the 1881–1882, 1884–1885, and 1886–1887 seasons. Particularly admired for her portrayal of <a href="Carmen">Carmen</a>, she was greatly loved by the audiences at Madrid's <a href="Teatro%20Real">Teatro Real</a> where she appeared from 1879 to 1897.
